result.execSummary:
The defendant Codi L Howerton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to 15CF180 & concurrent with 15CF183 & 15CF184.

miscConds.notes:
The Def is to obtain and maintain full time employment or enroll in a course of education or a combination of both.
.
Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and aftercare plan and  follow through with any treatment recommendations.

Def to undergo Psychological Evaluation within 60 days upon release and follow through with any recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random screenings.

No contact with any known drug users/dealers.
.

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendent in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

  Pay DOC Supervision fees.

Thinking for a Change program & follow through with any treatment recommendations.

  Def to undergo Domestic Abuse Assessment and follow through with any recommendations.

Address grief issues.
.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Codi L Howerton

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
